item.title: OpenStack Devstack up and running with Vagrant, in 12.5 minutes
item.description: I’d like to develop for OpenStack The eaiest way to start, is to use a project called devstack. Devstack is: A documented shell script to build complete OpenStack development environments. It looks promising. Unfortunately, the script is not as simple as what is claimed on the website: git clone https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack.git # configure, while optional... cd devstack; ./stack.sh There be Dragons. So? After looking at a number of different search results on the Internets, digging through some Chef cookbooks, Puppet stuff, here’s a Vagrant file to set up Devstack using Vagrant (Ubuntu 12.
